alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 2:43PM MST until February 08 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Natrona County in central Wyoming... South central Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 330 PM MST. * At 242 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Teapot Rock, or 27 miles north of Casper, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 176 and 254. Locations impacted include... Casper, Kaycee, Mills, Evansville, Bar Nunn, Red Butte, Midwest, Homa Hills, Edgerton, Antelope Hills, Teapot Rock, Paradise Valley, and Casper-Natrona County International Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
